eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraZoom
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows to zoom camera on a layer with a speed (factor per second).
description: ## Description

This extension allows to zoom a camera on a layer at a given speed. The zoom speed is configurable and allows a constant as well as a variable zoom speed. An anchor point can be defined, for instance, to keep what is under the cursor at the same place on screen.
### Actions
- Zoom at a given speed
- Change the zoom with an anchor point
- Zoom at a given speed and with an anchor point

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeed

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change camera zoom to: _PARAM1_ with an anchor at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

events.comment:
When zooming the vector in pixels from the center to the anchor must stay the same.
It gives this system:

/ pixel_delta(t-1) = (anchor - center(t-1)) * zoom(t-1)
| pixel_delta(t) = (anchor - center(t)) * zoom(t)
\ pixel_delta(t) = pixel_delta(t-1)

where the new center can be resolved to:

center(t) = anchor + (center(t-1) - anchor) * zoom(t-1) / zoom(t)

parameters:
GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorX")
+ (
   CameraX(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
   - GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorX")
)
* CameraZoom(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
/ GetArgumentAsNumber("Zoom")

GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorY")
+ (
   CameraY(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
   - GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorY")
)
* CameraZoom(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
/ GetArgumentAsNumber("Zoom")

parameters.longDescription: 1: Initial zoom, 2: zoom in x2, 0.5: zoom out x2...
parameters.name: Zoom

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second) and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Zoom camera with speed and anchor
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeedAndAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Zoom camera with speed: _PARAM1_ and an anchror at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PinchGesture
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the camera or objects with pinching gestures.
description: This extension allows to:
* Move, rotate and/or zoom the camera according to pinch gestures
* Move, rotate and optionally scale objects according to pinch gestures
* Handle more specific needs with various expressions
Limitations:
* Only one pinching gesture is detected at a time

eventsFunctions.description: Enable or disable camera pinch.
eventsFunctions.name: EnableCameraPinch

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera pinch is enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: IsCameraPinchEnabled

eventsFunctions.description: Choose the layer to move with pinch gestures.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCameraPinchLayer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Choose the layer _PARAM1_ to move with pinch gestures

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera pinch constraint.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCameraPinchConstraint
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the camera pinch constraint to _PARAM1_

parameters.name: Constraint
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["No constraint","Zoom only","Rotation only","Zoom and rotation only"]

eventsFunctions.description: Pinch the camera of a layer.
eventsFunctions.name: PinchCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Pinch the camera of layer: _PARAM1_ with constraint: _PARAM2_

events.comment: Save the initial state because the pinch is calculated from here.
Backup the camera state to revert pinch effect according to constraints.

parameters.name: Constraint
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["No constraint","Zoom only","Rotation only","Zoom and rotation only"]

events.comment: Pinch with more than 2 touches is not handled.
2nd touch started: save the 2 touches locations
It's important to do this case after because TouchCount is incremented in this loop (0 to 1 and 1 to 2 must not happen with the same touch event).

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a touch is pinching, if 2 touches are pressed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPinching

eventsFunctions.description: Return the scaling of the pinch gesture from its beginning.
eventsFunctions.name: Scaling

eventsFunctions.description: Return the rotation of the pinch gesture from its beginning (in degrees).
eventsFunctions.name: Rotation

eventsFunctions.description: Return the X position of the pinch center at the beginning of the gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: BeginningCenterX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the Y position of the pinch center at the beginning of the gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: BeginningCenterY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the X position of the pinch center.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentCenterX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the Y position of the pinch center.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentCenterY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the horizontal translation of the pinch gesture from its beginning.
eventsFunctions.name: TranslationX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the vertical translation of the pinch gesture from its beginning.
eventsFunctions.name: TranslationY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the new X position of a point after the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: TransformedX

parameters:
PinchGesture::CurrentCenterX("Layer") + PinchGesture::Scaling() * PinchGesture::RotatedVectorX(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterY("Layer"),
  PinchGesture::Rotation()
)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the new Y position of a point after the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: TransformedY

parameters:
PinchGesture::CurrentCenterY("Layer") + PinchGesture::Scaling() * PinchGesture::RotatedVectorY(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::BeginningCenterY("Layer"),
  PinchGesture::Rotation()
)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the original X position of a point before the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: InversedX

parameters:
PinchGesture::BeginningCenterX("Layer") + PinchGesture::RotatedVectorX
(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterY("Layer"),
  -PinchGesture::Rotation()
) / PinchGesture::Scaling()

eventsFunctions.description: Return the new position on the Y axis of a point after the pinch gesture.
eventsFunctions.name: InversedY

parameters:
PinchGesture::BeginningCenterY("Layer") + PinchGesture::RotatedVectorY
(
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionX") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterX("Layer"),
  GetArgumentAsNumber("PositionY") - PinchGesture::CurrentCenterY("Layer"),
  -PinchGesture::Rotation()
) / PinchGesture::Scaling()

eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Pichable

events.comment: Only the objects with the highest Z-Order will be actually pinched (see doStepPostEvents).
Move the object according to the pinch gesture.

Only the objects with the highest Z-Order are actually pinched.
If all objects have the same Z-Order, they can all be picked at once.

description: Provides two conditions:
* The cursor is moving
* The cursor has stayed still for a given duration

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Drag camera with the mouse (or touchscreen)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
How to use:
- Run this action on every frame that you want the camera to be movable by the mouse (or touchscreen)
- Select the mouse button to use (choose "left" for touchscreen)
- Select which directions the camera will move (vertical, horizontal, or both)
- Select the layer that will be moved
Tips:
- If no parameters are selected, the camera will move in both directions when the left mouse button (or touchscreen) are dragged.

eventsFunctions.description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ directions using _PARAM4_ mouse button

events.comment: When mouse button is pressed, get starting position of mouse
When mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
If selected direction is horizontal, both, or left blank, move camera on X axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel
If direction is vertical, both, or left blank, move camera on Y axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel

parameters.description: Directions that the camera can move (horizontal, vertical, both)
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Lizard-13
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SnapToGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Action to snap objects to a virtual grid during the game.
description: An action which, when applied on some objects, snap these objects to a *virtual grid*, with cells having customizable width and height.
Useful for level editors or putting objects on a tiled based map (RPG, strategy games, or any tiled based game in general).

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid (i.e: this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual grid using cells with  width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Ahnaf30e
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FPS
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds expressions and a behavior to get and display the game FPS.
description: Adds expressions to get the current FPS and a behavior to display the current FPS easily.

The FPS, Frames Per Second, describes how many times in the last second your game got updated. An update consists in running all the behaviors, objects, and events sheet code, before rendering the new game state into the game window. The higher the FPS, the more it manages to update in a second, influencing how fluid and performant your game looks.

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count.
eventsFunctions.name: FPS

eventsFunctions.description: Return your game's current FPS count, with more control over rounding.
eventsFunctions.name: PreciseFPS

parameters.longDescription: This tells how many numbers after the period should be shown.
parameters.name: accuracy

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Makes a text object display the current FPS.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FPSDisplayer

propertyDescriptors.label: The prefix before the FPS count
propertyDescriptors.name: prefix
